get.description: Retrieves all deployment templates.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: An optional key/value pair in the form of (key:value) that will act as a filter and exclude any templates that do not have a matching metadata item associated.

parameters.name: show_instance_configurations
parameters.description: If true, will return details for each instance configuration referenced by the template.

parameters.name: show_max_zones
parameters.description: If true, will populate the max_zones field in the instance configurations. Only relevant if show_instance_configurations=true.

parameters.description: If present, it will cause the returned deployment templates to be adapted to return only the elements allowed in that version.

post.description:
Creates the extension.
 The extensions API supports two types of usage patterns.
 A). Specify a `download_url`, http or https URL,  where the extension is currently hosted. This will result in extension being copied to elastic repository.
 B). Create only the extension metadata using the `POST` endpoint and then use `PUT` to upload the extension file. Leave the `download_url` unspecified in this case.

201.description: The extension that was just created.

400.description: Could not download the extension from the specified URL. (code: `extensions.request_execution_failed`)

404.description: Your current session does not have a user id associated with it. (code: `extensions.no_user_id`)

409.description: An extension already exists with the generated id. Please try again. (code: `extensions.id_already_exists`)

get.description: Retrieves all of the available extensions.

parameters.name: include_deployments
parameters.description:
Include deployments referencing this extension.
DEPRECATED: To get the list of deployments that reference an extension, use the Get Extension API.

200.description: The extensions that are available

get.description: By default, retrieves only the available Elastic Stack versions. To retrieve all of the Elastic Stack versions, use the `show_deleted parameter`.

parameters.name: show_deleted
parameters.description: Whether to show deleted stack versions or not

parameters.name: show_unusable
parameters.description: Whether to show versions that are unusable by the authenticated user

200.description: The list of all available Elastic Stack versions are retrieved, including the template version and structure.

post.description: Restarts a Stateless Resource. If a Resource is active: this command re-applies the existing plan but applies a "cluster_reboot", which issues a restart command and waits for it to complete. If a Resource is inactive: this command starts it up with the most recent successful plan.

parameters.description: Identifier for the Deployment.

parameters.name: ref_id
parameters.description: User-specified RefId for the Resource.

parameters.description: If true, cancels any pending plans before restarting. If false and there are pending plans, returns an error.

post.description: Restarts an Elasticsearch Resource. If a Resource is active: this command re-applies the existing plan but applies a "cluster_reboot", which issues a restart command and waits for it to complete. If a Resource is inactive: this command starts it up with the most recent successful plan.

parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the Deployment.

parameters.name: ref_id
parameters.description: User-specified RefId for the Resource.

parameters.name: restore_snapshot
parameters.description: When set to true and restoring from shutdown, then will restore the cluster from the last snapshot (if available).

parameters.name: skip_snapshot
parameters.description: If true, will not take a snapshot of the cluster before restarting.

parameters.name: cancel_pending
parameters.description: If true, cancels any pending plans before restarting. If false and there are pending plans, returns an error.

parameters.name: group_attribute
parameters.description: Indicates the property or properties used to divide the list of instances to restart in groups. Valid options are: '\_\_all\_\_' (restart all at once), '\_\_zone\_\_' by logical zone, '\_\_name\_\_' one instance at a time, or a comma-separated list of attributes of the instances

parameters.name: shard_init_wait_time
parameters.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for shards that show no progress of initializing, before rolling the next group (default: 10 minutes)

202.description: The restart command was issued successfully.

404.description:
* The Deployment specified by {deployment_id} cannot be found. (code: `deployments.deployment_not_found`)
* The Resource specified by {ref_id} cannot be found. (code: `deployments.deployment_resource_not_found`)

422.description: The command sent to a Resource found the Resource in an illegal state, the error message gives more details. (code: `deployments.deployment_resource_plan_change_error`)

500.description: A Resource that was previously stored no longer exists. (code: `deployments.deployment_resource_no_longer_exists`)

post.description: Starts maintenance mode of all instances belonging to a Deployment Resource.

parameters.name: deployment_id
parameters.description: Identifier for the Deployment.

parameters.name: resource_kind
parameters.description: The kind of resource (one of elasticsearch, kibana or apm).

parameters.name: ref_id

elasticsearch_url.description: Optionally override the URL to which to send data (for advanced users only, if unspecified the system selects an internal URL)

secret_token.description: Optionally override the secret token within APM - defaults to the previously existing secretToken

elasticsearch_password.description: Optionally override the account within APM - defaults to a system account that always exists (if specified, the username must also be specified). Note that this field is never returned from the API, it is write only.

debug_enabled.description: Optionally enable debug mode for APM servers - defaults false

kibana_url.description: Optionally override the URL to which to send data (for advanced users only, if unspecified the system selects an internal URL)

elasticsearch_username.description: Optionally override the account within APM - defaults to a system account that always exists (if specified, the password must also be specified). Note that this field is never returned from the API, it is write only.

ApmSystemSettings.description:
A structure that defines a curated subset of the APM Server settings. 
TIP: To define the complete set of APM Server setting, use `ApmSystemSettings` with `user_settings_override_` and `user_settings_`.

settings.description: Settings that are applied to all nodes of this type

node_types.description: Node types that are supported by this stack version

blacklist.description: List of configuration options that cannot be overridden by user settings

compatible_node_types.description: Node types that are compatible with this one

StackVersionElasticsearchConfig.description: The Elasticsearch configuration for an Elastic Stack version.

resource.description: The resource type of the instance configuration

id.description: The id of the configuration used to create the instance

name.description: The name of the configuration used to create the instance

ClusterInstanceConfigurationInfo.description: Information about a configuration that creates a Kibana instance or APM Server.

resources.description: Costs of the list of resources

data_transfer_and_storage.description: List of the detailed costs associated to the Data Transfer and Storage (DTS) dimensions

ItemsCosts.description: Costs associated to a set of Elastic Cloud resources for an organization. All of the costs are expressed in Elastic Consumption Unit (ECU).

format.description: Formatted dates will be parsed using the format specified on the date field by default, but it can be overridden by passing the format parameter.

time_zone.description: Dates can be converted from another timezone to UTC either by specifying the time zone in the date value itself (if the format accepts it), or it can be specified as the time_zone parameter.

boost.description: An optional boost value to apply to the query.

RangeQuery.description: The query that matches documents with fields that contain terms within a specified range.

AppSearchPlan.description: The plan for the App Search cluster.

azure_endpoint_name.description: Name of the Azure Private Endpoint to allow connections from

source.description: Allowed traffic filter source: IP address, CIDR mask, or VPC endpoint ID

azure_endpoint_guid.description: Resource GUID of the Azure Private Endpoint to allow connections from

id.description: The rule ID

TrafficFilterRule.description: The container for a traffic filter rule.

MatchAllQuery.description: A query that matches all documents.

protocol.description: The target protocol for an egress rule

target.description: Allowed traffic filter egress target: IP address or CIDR mask

ports.description: A list of target ports for an egress rule

TrafficFilterEgressRule.description: The rule detail for a traffic filter egress rule.

region.description: The ruleset can be attached only to deployments in the specific region

include_by_default.description: Should the ruleset be automatically included in the new deployments

TrafficFilterRulesetRequest.description: The specification for traffic filter ruleset.

skip_synced_flush.description: Whether to skip attempting to do a synced flush on the filesystem of the container (default: false), which is less safe but may be required if the container is unhealthy

allow_inline_resize.description: Whether we allow changing the capacity of instances (default false). This is currently implemented by stopping, re-creating then starting the affected instance on its associated allocator when performing the changes. NOTES: This requires a round-trip through the allocation infrastructure of the active constructor, as it has to reserve the target capacity without over-committing

group_by.description: Specifies the grouping attribute to use when rolling several instances. Instances that share the same value for the provided attribute key are rolled together as a unit. Examples that make sense to use are '\_\_all\_\_' (roll all instances as a single unit), 'logical_zone_name' (roll instances by zone), '\_\_name\_\_' (roll one instance at a time, the default if not specified). Note that '\_\_all\_\_' is required when performing a major version upgrade

shard_init_wait_time.description: The time, in seconds, to wait for shards that show no progress of initializing before rolling the next group (default: 10 minutes)

RollingStrategyConfig.description: Performs inline, rolling configuration changes that mutate existing containers. TIP: This is the fastest way to update a plan, but can fail for complex plan changes, such as topology changes. Also, this is less safe for configuration changes that leave a cluster in a non running state. NOTE: When you perform a major version upgrade, and 'group_by' is set to 'pass:macros[__all__]';, rolling is required.

healthy.description: Whether the deployment logging is healthy or not

issues.description: Logging health issues for the deployment

urls.description: The URLs to view this deployment's logs in Kibana

disk_space_available.description: If known, the amount of total disk space available to the container in MB

storage_multiplier.description: The storage multiplier originally defined to calculate disk space.

disk_space_used.description: The amount of disk space being used by the service in MB

ClusterInstanceDiskInfo.description: Information about the use and storage capacity of a Kibana instance or APM Server.

trust_all.description: If true, all clusters in this account will by default trust all other clusters in the same account

AccountTrustSettings.description: Settings related to the level of trust of the clusters in this account

display_name.description: The human readable name for the cluster (defaults to the generated cluster id if not specified)

Elasticsearch.description: Holds diagnostics for an Elasticsearch cluster

resources.description: Total costs associated to the Elastic Cloud resources

data_transfer_and_storage.description: Total costs associated to Data Transfer and Storage (DTS)

Costs.description: Costs overview for an organization. All of the costs, credits, trials are expressed in Elastic Consumption Unit (ECU).

kind.description: The kind of the stateless resource

id.description: The id of the deployment

ref_id.description: The reference id of the resource

DeploymentResourceCrudResponse.description: A response returned from the Deployment Resource endpoints

cluster_reboot.description: Set to 'forced' to force a reboot as part of the upgrade plan

extended_maintenance.description: If true (default false), does not clear the maintenance flag (which prevents its API from being accessed except by the constructor) on new instances added until after a snapshot has been restored, otherwise, the maintenance flag is cleared once the new instances successfully join the new cluster

calm_wait_time.description: This timeout determines how long to give a cluster after it responds to API calls before performing actual operations on it. It defaults to 5s

timeout.description: The total timeout in seconds after which the plan is cancelled even if it is not complete. Defaults to 4x the max memory capacity per node (in MB)

ApmPlanControlConfiguration.description: The plan control configuration options for the APM Server.

DeploymentMetricsSettings.description: The metrics settings for a deployment

elasticsearch_password.description: Optionally override the account within Elasticsearch - defaults to a system account that always exists (if specified, the username must also be specified). Note that this field is never returned from the API, it is write only.

elasticsearch_username.description: Optionally override the account within Elasticsearch - defaults to a system account that always exists (if specified, the password must also be specified). Note that this field is never returned from the API, it is write only.

elasticsearch_url.description: Optionally override the URL to which to send data (for advanced users only, if unspecified the system selects an internal URL)

KibanaSystemSettings.description: A subset of Kibana settings. TIP: To define the complete set of Elasticsearch settings, use `KibanaSystemSettings` with `user_settings_override_` and `user_settings_`.

errors.description: A list of errors that occurred in the failing request

url.description: The URL of the bundle, which must be accessible from the ECE infrastructure. This URL could be cached by platform, make sure to change it when updating the bundle

elasticsearch_version.description: The supported Elasticsearch version (must match the version in the plan)

ElasticsearchUserBundle.description: A list of admin-uploaded bundle objects, such as scripts and synonym files.

reindex_whitelist.description: Limits remote Elasticsearch clusters that can be used as the source for '_reindex' API commands

default_shards_per_index.description: (2.x only - to get the same result in 5.x template mappings must be used) Sets the default number of shards per index, defaulting to 1 if not specified. (Corresponds to the parameter 'index.number_of_shards' in 2.x, not supported in 5.x)

monitoring_history_duration.description: The duration for which monitoring history is stored (format '(NUMBER)d' eg '3d' for 3 days). NOTES: ('Corresponds to the parameter xpack.monitoring.history.duration' in 5.x, defaults to '7d')

monitoring_collection_interval.description: The default interval at which monitoring information from the cluster if collected, if monitoring is enabled. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'marvel.agent.interval' in 2.x and 'xpack.monitoring.collection.interval' in 5.x)

destructive_requires_name.description: If true (default is false) then the index deletion API will not support wildcards or '_all'. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'action.destructive_requires_name')

auto_create_index.description: If true (the default), then any write operation on an index that does not currently exist will create it. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'action.auto_create_index')

watcher_trigger_engine.description: The trigger engine for Watcher, defaults to 'scheduler' - see the xpack documentation for more information. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter '(xpack.)watcher.trigger.schedule.engine', depending on version. Ignored from 6.x onwards.)

use_disk_threshold.description: Whether to factor in the available disk space on a node before deciding whether to allocate new shards to that node or actively relocate shards away from the node (default: true). NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameter 'cluster.routing.allocation.disk.threshold_enabled')

enable_close_index.description: Defaults to false on versions <= 7.2.0, true otherwise. If false, then the API commands to close indices are disabled. This is important because Elasticsearch does not snapshot or migrate close indices on versions under 7.2.0, therefore standard Elastic Cloud configuration operations will cause irretrievable loss of indices' data. cluster_settings_json.description:
If specified, contains transient settings to be applied to an Elasticsearch cluster during changes, default values shown below applied.
These can be overridden by specifying them in the map (or null to unset). Additional settings can also be set. Settings will be cleared after the plan has finished. If not specified, no settings will be applied.
NOTE: These settings are only explicitly cleared for 5.x+ clusters, they must be hand-reset to their defaults in 2.x- (or a cluster reboot will clear them).
- indices.store.throttle.max_bytes_per_sec: 150Mb
- indices.recovery.max_bytes_per_sec: 150Mb
- cluster.routing.allocation.cluster_concurrent_rebalance: 10
- cluster.routing.allocation.node_initial_primaries_recoveries: 8
- cluster.routing.allocation.node_concurrent_incoming_recoveries: 8

DeploymentCosts.description: Detailed costs for a deployment for an organization. All of the costs are expressed in Elastic Consumption Unit (ECU).

ApiKeysResponse.description: The response model for the API keys.

instance_name.description: The Elastic Cloud name/id of the instance (container)

replica_count.description: The number of unavailable replicas on this instance

ElasticsearchReplicaElement.description: Information about the unavailable replicas. NOTE: Unlike shards, unavailable replicas indicate a loss of redundancy rather than a loss of availability.

attempt_end_time.description: If this plan completed or failed (ie is not pending), when the attempt ended (ISO format in UTC)

plan_attempt_id.description: A UUID for each plan attempt

healthy.description: Either the plan ended successfully, or is not yet completed (and no errors have occurred)

plan_end_time.description: If this plan is not current or pending, when the plan was no longer active (ISO format in UTC)

plan_attempt_name.description: A human readable name for each plan attempt, only populated when retrieving plan histories

attempt_start_time.description: When this plan attempt (ie to apply the plan to the cluster) started (ISO format in UTC)

ElasticsearchClusterPlanInfo.description: Information about the Elasticsearch cluster plan.

healthy.description: Whether the shard situation is healthy (any unavailable shards is unhealthy)

ElasticsearchShardsInfo.description: Information about the shards and replicas that comprise the Elasticsearch indices.

ElasticsearchClusterUser.description: The information about an Elasticsearch cluster user.

PlanStrategy.description: The options for performing a plan change. Specify only one property each time. The default is `grow_and_shrink`.

expressions_enabled.description: (5.x+ only) If enabled (the default) then the expressions scripting engine is allowed as a sandboxed language. Sandboxed languages are the only ones allowed if 'sandbox_mode' is set to true. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameters 'script.engine.expression.[file|stored|inline]')

painless_enabled.description: (5.x+ only) If enabled (the default) then the painless scripting engine is allowed as a sandboxed language. Sandboxed languages are the only ones allowed if 'sandbox_mode' is set to true. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameters 'script.engine.painless.[file|stored|inline]')

mustache_enabled.description: (5.x+ only) If enabled (the default) then the mustache scripting engine is allowed as a sandboxed language. Sandboxed languages are the only ones allowed if 'sandbox_mode' is set to true. NOTES: (Corresponds to the parameters 'script.engine.mustache.[file|stored|inline]')

ElasticsearchScriptingUserSettings.description: Controls the languages supported by the Elasticsearch cluster, such as Painless, Mustache, and Expressions. Controls how the languages are used, such as file, index, and inline. TIP: For complex configurations, leave these blank and configure these settings in the user YAML or JSON.

target_cluster_id.description: The Id of the target cluster to which to send monitoring information

ManagedMonitoringSettings.description: The settings for sending monitoring information to another cluster.

user_settings_override_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_yaml' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of Apm settings)

user_settings_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_json' is allowed), provided the parameters are on the allowlist and not on the denylist. (These field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of Apm settings)

version.description: The version of the Apm cluster (must be one of the ECE supported versions, and won't work unless it matches the APM version. Leave blank to auto-detect version.)

user_settings_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing (non-admin) cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_yaml' is allowed), provided the parameters are on the allowlist and not on the denylist. (This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of Apm settings)

user_settings_override_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of Apm settings)

docker_image.description: A docker URI that allows overriding of the default docker image specified for this version

ApmConfiguration.description: The configuration options for the APM Server.

repository_name.description: If specified, contains the name of the snapshot repository - else will default to the Elastic Cloud system repo ('found-snapshots')

strategy.description: The restore strategy to use. Defaults to a full restore. Partial restore will attempt to restore unavailable indices only

source_cluster_id.description: If specified, contains the name of the source cluster id. Do not send this if you are sending repository_config

snapshot_name.description: The name of the snapshot to restore. Use '\_\_latest_success\_\_' to get the most recent snapshot from the specified repository

RestoreSnapshotConfiguration.description: Restores a snapshot from a local or remote repository.

cost.description: Costs associated to the Data Transfer and Storage (DTS) dimensions for an organization

type.description: Type of the DTS dimension usage

DtsDimensionCosts.description: The costs associated to a Data Transfer and Storage (DTS) dimension for an organization. All of the costs, credits, and trials are expressed in Elastic Consumption Units (ECU).

user_settings_override_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_yaml' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. NOTES: (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of Elasticsearch settings)

enabled_built_in_plugins.description: A list of plugin names from the Elastic-supported subset that are bundled with the version images. NOTES: (Users should consult the Elastic stack objects to see what plugins are available, this is currently only available from the UI)

user_plugins.description: A list of admin-uploaded plugin objects that are available for this user.

user_settings_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_json' is allowed), provided the parameters arey are on the allowlist and not on the denylist. NOTES: (This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of Elasticsearch settings)

user_bundles.description: A list of admin-uploaded bundle objects (eg scripts, synonym files) that are available for this user.

version.description: The version of the Elasticsearch cluster (must be one of the ECE supported versions). Currently cannot be different across the topology (and is generally specified in the globals). Defaults to the latest version if not specified.

user_settings_json.description: An arbitrary JSON object allowing cluster owners to set their parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_yaml' is allowed), provided the parameters arey are on the allowlist and not on the denylist. NOTES: (This field together with 'user_settings_override*' and 'system_settings' defines the total set of Elasticsearch settings)

user_settings_override_yaml.description: An arbitrary YAML object allowing ECE admins owners to set clusters' parameters (only one of this and 'user_settings_override_json' is allowed), ie in addition to the documented 'system_settings'. NOTES: (This field together with 'system_settings' and 'user_settings*' defines the total set of Elasticsearch settings)

docker_image.description: A docker URI that allows overriding of the default docker image specified for this version

node_attributes.description: Defines the Elasticsearch node attributes for the instances in the topology

ElasticsearchConfiguration.description: The Elasticsearch cluster settings. When specified at the top level, provides a field-by-field default. When specified at the topology level, provides the override settings.

count.description: Number of snapshots stored for this cluster

scheduled_time.description: Scheduled time of next snapshot attempt

latest_end_time.description: The end time of the most recently attempted snapshot

healthy.description: Health status of snapshots for this cluster

recent_success.description: Indicates whether the cluster has a relatively recent successful snapshot.

latest_successful_end_time.description: The end time of the most recently successful snapshot

latest_status.description: Status of the latest snapshot attempt, if any exist.

SnapshotStatusInfo.description: Information about the snapshot status for the Elasticsearch cluster. For example, the health status.

TransientAppSearchPlanConfiguration.description: Defines configuration parameters that control how the plan (ie consisting of the cluster topology and AppSearch settings) is applied

healthy.description: Whether the deployment is overall healthy or not (one or more of the resource info subsections will have healthy: false)

alias.description: A user-defined deployment alias for user-friendly resource URLs

id.description: A randomly-generated id of this Deployment

healthy.description: Whether the plan situation is healthy (if unhealthy, means the last plan attempt failed)

ElasticsearchClusterPlansInfo.description: Information about the current, pending, and past Elasticsearch cluster plans.

elasticsearch_cluster_ref_id.description: Alias to the Elasticsearch Cluster to attach AppSearch to

display_name.description: The human readable name for the AppSearch cluster (default: takes the name of its Elasticsearch cluster)

region.description: The region where this resource exists

ref_id.description: A locally-unique user-specified id for AppSearch

AppSearchPayload.description: An AppSearch creation request paired with the alias of the Elasticsearch cluster it should be paired with
